nodes.bodyText:
Why are we using an old version? and also a + instead of a fully resolved version?
p.s. the latest version according to docs is: implementation 'com.microsoft.identity.client:msal:1.+'
We need to change the implementation to move to the latest version of  client:msal.
Ok, I would suggest creating a ticket for the up gradation then.

This comment should be above this line:
// Apply the Performance Monitoring plugin to enable instrumentation

I would suggest we use a block comment here instead of multi-line comments.
nit:
, so adding the following statement to resolve the build issue.
instead of
 so ad below statement to resolve build issue.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -259,6 +260,13 @@ def firebaseEnabled = firebaseConfig?.get('ENABLED')
 if (firebaseEnabled ?: false) {
     apply plugin: 'com.google.gms.google-services'
     // Apply the Performance Monitoring plugin to enable instrumentation
+    // Getting some libraries conflict after adding the microsoft client library for microsoft SSO
+    // with message "In project '*' a resolved Google Play services library dependency depends on
+    // another at an exact version (e.g. [1.3.1 ,2.3])." so ad below statement to resolve build issue.
+    // Ref: https://stackoverflow.com/a/57479692

nodes.bodyText:
Also, did you try updating com.google.gms:google-services to version 4.3.3 instead?
p.s. this is also mentioned as a solution in the SO link you've added in the comment.
Still unable to build after upgrading the com.google.gms:google-services to version 4.3.3.
The task that generates auth_config.json for the config and executes for the Microsoft authentication

         tasks.getByName(googleServicesJsonValidationTask).dependsOn(serviceJsonTask)
     }
 
+    // Task that generate auth_config.json for the config and execute for the Microsoft authentication

nodes.bodyText: java.net.URLEncoder is an unnecessary qualified reference, you can just use URLEncoder.encode instead.
why was this logic changed? previous logic seems fine to me
if Facebook and google are disabled, but this logic only hides facebook, not the google button.

This needs to be a block comment like:
    /*
     * Getting some libraries conflict after adding the microsoft client library for microsoft SSO
     * another at an exact version (e.g. [1.3.1 ,2.3]).", so adding the following statement to
     * resolve the build issue.
     * Ref: https://stackoverflow.com/a/57479692
     */
